intro: Ruellia lechleri, commonly known as the "sangre de drago" or dragon's blood plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue. Its sap is highly viscous and has been historically used for its medicinal properties. The plant's resilience to harsh environmental conditions makes it a valuable species in ecological studies.
